item.description: Mon, March 16 @ 7:00 1960s Big Screen Classics Audience Choice Winner http://feb28.com/2008/ethan/the-10-best-movies-ever-according-to-the-oscars/ A version of Romeo and Juliet so unique it is now regarded as something new. This ground-breaking musical story of gang warfare in New York, boasts an evergreen score by Leonard Bernstein and Stephen Sondheim and choreography by Jerome Robbins. The Jets and the Sharks have been battling each other for control of their neighborhood streets. There is no end in sight to the feud. When the sister of Sharks leader Bernardo and best friend of Jets leader Riff fall in love at a local dance, tensions flare.
item.name: 75th Big Screen Classics: WEST SIDE STORY
